fields.description:
Since yesterday I can't push files into my project anymore.\\
I've read around that I can't do much besides asking you guys to do something about it.\\
I get the famous "internal server error".

Thanks in advance
fields.summary: Internal Server Error on push

fields.description: It would be nice if we could use markdown (or some other wiki-formatting syntax) in commit messages and have them displayed nicely formatted.
fields.summary: Support markdown in commit messages (BB-10676)

fields.description:
Hello,

I just created a an account, but after this step I got an error message:

Your account has been disabled.\\
We're sorry. Your account has been flagged by our automated system for possible violation of our terms of service.

If this is an error, please contact Bitbucket Support to have it reinstated.

However I managed to activate my account and change some details thanks to the activation mail. But when I try to login, I still get the error message.

Any help? My acc is not SPAM. :(
fields.summary: Account deactivated after signing up

fields.description:
When I create a new Mercultial repo, the CLI instruction for Repository setup shows git push commands for a Mercurial repo. See below:

Set up Mercurial on your machine if you haven't already.

mkdir /path/to/your/projectcd /path/to/your/project\\
hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/svaksha/ira

Create your first file, commit, and push

echo "SVAKSHA ." >> contributors.txt\\
git add contributors.txt\\
git commit -m 'Initial commit with contributors'\\
git push -u origin master

Thanks.
fields.summary: CLI instruction for Repository setup shows git push commands for a Mercurial repo (BB-10646)

fields.description: Screenshot taken in Firefox 29.0.1 on Windows.
fields.summary: Layout broken if repository in transfer state (BB-10647)

fields.description: As the title suggests, I want to be able to tell people the issue has been resolved, and will be coming with version [whatever].
fields.summary: Allow users to change version when resolving issue (BB-10675)

fields.description: Perhaps related to BCLOUD-9492
fields.summary: Bitbucket UI sometimes displays a branch as having no commits (BB-10644)

fields.description: Sorry. It's my inattention. The issue should be closed.
fields.summary: Wrong number of issues on dashboard (not a bug).

fields.description:
When I click the eyeball icon to watch / unwatch an issue in a list of issues, the action seems to be processed correctly, but I get two notification messages at the top of the screen. Presumably there should only be one.

Firefox 29.0 on Ubuntu Linux
fields.summary: Duplicate notification message on issue watch / unwatch (BB-10689)

fields.description:
I have a relatively large number of SSH keys. It would be nice to have the UI for 'SSH keys' display the keys in alphabetical order by key name. This makes it easier to scan the list.

Another alternative the keeps the current behavior is to make the 'Key' and 'Added' column headers sort the SSH keys by that column. So clicking on 'Key' would sort by the key name. Clicking the same header again would sort in reverse order. I've done this for another project where JavaScript does the sorting. If you like I can attach the code to this issue.

It might also be nice to have a find (filter) box for SSH keys, similar to the find box that exists for repositories on the dashboard. This also makes it easy to scan the list, since it is shorter.

If I had to choose just one these three, I'd go for sorting by key name.
fields.summary: Sort SSH keys by label (BB-10658)

fields.description:
On my pull request:

https://bitbucket.org/empowernetwork/cron/pull-request/13/env-1890-and-env-1686-new-cron-job-for

It says:

"Error

We were unable to load this page."

where it would normally display the code for the change.

Firebug says:

"NetworkError: 500 INTERNAL SERVER ERROR - https://bitbucket.org/empowernetwork/cron/pull-request/13/env-1890-and-env-1686-new-cron-job-for/diff?_pjax=%23pr-tab-content"
fields.summary: Error On Pull Request Page

fields.description:
For many projects, like code libraries, utilities, small projects and many other kinds, you have no graphical representation, no icon or logo for the project. And if you have many projects, they tend to include the same languages.

Therefore, the repository logos tend to be identical across most of a teams projects. Which makes them quite useless.

I propose (auto-generated) [identicon|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Identicon] logos for repositories without a custom icon set.

I think that could look awesome, and be very helpful.
fields.summary: Auto-generate unique repository logo (identicons) (BB-10674)

fields.description: Few days before, I can still use setting options of repository and delete the whole repository.  With the latest new UI change, I cannot find out settings options from any toolbar or icon.  How can I delete repository?
fields.summary: new BitBucket UI

fields.description:
Using the key combination for the character '[' on a german keyboard (that ist ALT GR + 9) will not collapse the sidebar.

When switching the keyboard to english layout anything works as expected.
fields.summary: Cannot collapse sidebar with german/non-english keyboard layout

fields.description:
I was removing all the "merged" branches. When deleting the last branch on ?page=2 I then got a 404. Obviously changing the page to 1 worked.

Ideally I would have been redirected to the next lowest page. (3 would become 2)\\
But redirecting to page 1 would be sufficient at the least.
fields.summary: Deleting the last branch on a page will redirect you to a non-existent page (BB-10656)

fields.description:
This seems to be the same symptoms as BCLOUD-2616 which is closed, but someone added to that report in the last month.

When I upload a new file to the Downlpads area (i.e. not the hg repo) with the same name, I just download the old file back. Even if I delete the file and re-upload I get the old one.

Example: https://bitbucket.org/peterhull90/jumpman82/downloads\\
The old file had size 4425 bytes, the newly uploaded one has 4435 bytes but I always get the old version.

Is there a delay in activating the new version? (in which case it may be OK by the time someone else sees this!)
fields.summary: Downloads not up-to-date

fields.description:
Just a suggestion to allow open of attached documents and spreadsheets, forms, etc... directly inside the browser with Google Documents.

https://docs.google.com
fields.summary: Open attached documents with Google Documents

fields.description: Hope it is not just me, but when I click on a commit under the commits tab for a PR, I find it annoying that I need to navigate back to the PR via the PRs list or using the back button. Would be cool if it just opened the commit on the commits tab for the PR so that I can easily navigate back the PR overview.
fields.summary: Allow users to step through commits of a pull request without navigating away from PR (BB-10657)

fields.description:
When screenschot is attached to bug, it appears as a small 178x100 pixels image.\\
However, it is scaled down full size image (in my case 1379x940 pixels, 2.3MiB).

Attaching screenshots to bug report is quite common. If you generate thumbnails on server side, and use small image as a link to large image you would save a lot of traffic and time (for both you and your users). Scaled image in my case is 30KiB instead of 2.3MiB.

BTW, I love Bitbucket. You guys are awesome!
fields.summary: Generate thumbnails for issue image attachments (BB-10653)

fields.description:
Add support for LiveScript Language.

http://livescript.net/
fields.summary: LiveScript Language

fields.description: Clicking on "change logo" link on the repository settings page does nothing (actually it takes me to the #change-logo anchor that's at the bottom of the page but no dialog is shown.). Works correctly in Chrome for OSX.
fields.summary: Unable to change logo (Safari 7.0.3)

fields.description: after the new theme roll out the search is not working
fields.summary: Search is not working

fields.description: The Pull Request table should include the destination branch.  When developers are working with many branches and sub-branches, it would be very useful to be able to see, at a glance, which branch a Pull Request will be merged into.  This is also useful when there are maintenance and new-release branches being worked on simultaneously.  The release manager can focus on the Pull Requests destined for the version he is currently working with.
fields.summary: Pull request list should include the destination branch (BB-10652)

fields.description:
I am noticing issues again with the code embed feature, in the past ([previous issue|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7415/code-embedded-into-other-sites-missing]) the highlighting did not work.  Now the code is not embedded at all.

I have multiple code embeds on [this page|http://www.fpgarelated.com/showarticle/25.php] and others.  Any insight is appreciated.
fields.summary: code embed not displaying

fields.description:
When resolving an issue, it would be nice if the user had the option to associate the resolution with a recent commit that has been made. I end up linking to the commit in the comment section as an alternative.

A simple dropdown box with the 10 most recent commits would suffice.
fields.summary: Ability to associate resolution of an issue with a recent commit (BB-10655)

fields.description:
When a PR is opened, the Approve/Unapprove button was first i18n-ed (seems to be always "Approve"), but then was quickly changed to the correct English version.

http://monosnap.com/file/2alSQejHzD8uwrbAyPLQ0DrcpvO2wZ
fields.summary: Approve/unapprove Javascript strings should be internationalized (BB-10651)

fields.description:
Right now the "new to Git?" box which shows up on the main landing page cannot be disabled.  In the past informational stuff like this was only shown once and then never again after being toggled off.  I'd like to be able to do the same thing with this box, but there doesn't seem to be a way to do that in the new design.

This is particularly frustrating because the box is taking real estate from the activity feed, which was already made significantly smaller with the redesign.
fields.summary: Allow dismissal of "New to Git?" box on dashboard (BB-10650)

fields.description:
Small bug

In my quest to find a better way to delete a pull request I came across  this:

Trying to update a pull request with no source branch (because it's been deleted) results in a  raw json dump.

Cheers
fields.summary: Updating a pull request after deleting source branch results in raw JSON response (BB-10649)

fields.description: When pull or push to bitbucket alway error connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Connection refused
fields.summary: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Connection refused

fields.description: The new sidebar has a collapse function bound to a "["-key. My nordic keyboard doesn't have such key (The "["-character is found under AltGr+8) so the keyboard shortcut is not available.
fields.summary: Sidebar keyboard shotcut on other layouts than English (BB-10634)

fields.description: The size of the repo is not shown on the repo overview page in the new layout.
fields.summary: Repo size not available

fields.description:
Maybe it will be useful to have a possibility to mark team account SSH key as read-only, and use this key as deployment key for all team repos.

Teams accounts is now used only for grouping users and centralized access management, so commits from team account are become rare thing.

Or, please, provide us other possibility to manage deployment keys for all projects from one place through web interface.

It's not very convenient to use bitbucket API calls for this, because of the need to create dedicated software for this.
fields.summary: Deployment key for team account.

fields.description: There is scrollbar on small resolutions in new left menu (see screenshot)
fields.summary: Left menu on small resolutions (<600 px) (BB-10633)

fields.description:
Hey guys,

It looks like you are trying to make Bitbucket look more like Jira now. What was good about Bitbucket, however, is that it was NOT that Atlasssian commercial issue tracker, and this was what most people liked. The previous layout with the project menu at the top, but not on the left, was perfect for navigation. Now what you basically did is made the user experience worse as now we (users) have to perform more actions to use that one, as well as there are now 3 menus (left, top and top right) which are located in different parts of the screen.

I know that as you have already made this change, it would be pretty unlikely to get the previous UI back, however, please at least think about that, as what you have done simply sucks compared to what we had before.
fields.summary: Please consider reverting to the previous layout as the new one is worse

fields.description:
The repository list in the default Overview tab on Dashboard links specifically to the overview page of each repository, not respecting the Landing page option that can be set for each repository.

If Landing page is set to Wiki, the link in the repository list should link to the Wiki page.
fields.summary: Dashboard Overview page should respect repostiory Landing page option (BB-10632)

fields.description:
Diff fails to load on pull request page when target branch doesn't exist yet.

Example Pull Request:\\
https://bitbucket.org/wfmdigitalweb/wfmcom/pull-request/853/qd-1337-added-google-button-to-blog-page/diff

A branch wfmcom/QD-1337 doesnt exist yet so because of this bug it's diff doesn't load for this Pull request. Instead it throws an error (also see screenshot):

{code}
#!quote

Error
We were unable to load this page.
{code}

Merging topic branches this way is our main git-flow approach and it used to work just fine before last week.

Currently this error [happens(1)|https://bitbucket.org/wfmdigitalweb/wfmcom/pull-request/859/qd-1878-format-emailed-event-links] [every(2)|https://bitbucket.org/wfmdigitalweb/wfmcom/pull-request/835/qd-1596-store-locator-should-redirect-the] [time(3)|https://bitbucket.org/wfmdigitalweb/wfmcom/pull-request/832/rebase-of-qd-112-fix-on-top-of-current] when target branch does not exist which *almost blocks* our ability to review Pull requests on the project.

We are a remote team and it's very hard to go to the parent team and ask them to create a copy of master branch in target repo and name it as target branch only so diff would display. This kills the whole automation idea.

Please pay attention to this issue!
fields.summary: Diff fails to load on pull request page when target branch doesn't exist yet

fields.description:
Hello,\\
Could you add a reference to every new pull request that is made so that the code in the pull request can be checked out by pulling the remote?\\
It would be extremely helpful when you want to checkout a new pull request to test it locally. I know [there is a way to checkout new pull requests|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Work%2Bwith%2Bpull%2Brequests#Workwithpullrequests-Gitcommandlineexample] but it takes a little bit.

It is already on github and you every pull request has a own reference. When I run {{git ls-remote github url}} on a github repo, I get:\\
SHA... 	refs/heads/master\\
SHA... 	refs/pull/1/head

Since pull requests aren't in refs/heads, you won't have way too many branches when clone a repo, unless you change the fetch config to fetch = +refs/pull/_/head:refs/remotes/origin/pr/_

It especially gets useful if want to automatically test the pull request on CI programs like Jenkins.
fields.summary: New references to branch for each pull request.

fields.description:
The brand new fluid width Bitbucket layout seems good, but it totally changes focus from recent activity.

My company have lots of repositories with quite low activity in each, and the recent activity focus in previous version was a perfect fit for us.

I suggest a new tab on the Dashboard page, in addition to Overview, Pull requests and Issues, called _Recent activity_.

_Recent activity_ could be quite like that old Overview page.
fields.summary: Add activity centric tab to new Dashboard page (BB-10631)

fields.description: Hello, when I try to sign in it says my account has been deactivated and to contact support.
fields.summary: Account deactivated

fields.description:
Using the new layout, repository links on my profile at my custom domain (ie http:/[/domain]/) link to http://[domain]/[user]/[repo] instead of http://[domain]/[repo]

Links in the Recent Activity feed are unaffected.
fields.summary: 404 from Custom Domain profile

fields.description:
With the new fluid width site it seems there is some scrolling JS glitching out on pages shorter than the window height. It looks like it attempts to scroll the page when there is no content to scroll through.

Spotted in Chrome 34.0.1847.137 on OS X 10.9.2.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Open a bitbucket.org page that is shallow in a large window, such as the create issue or repository settings pages.
# Scroll down.

*Expected:*

No scrolling occurs as there is no content to scroll to.

*Actual:*

Page attempts to scroll, popping back up in a jarring manner.
fields.summary: Scrolling on short pages is glitchy in fluid width layout (BB-10597)

fields.description: We have two files in our repo, one called README and the other one called README.MD. A click on edit README opens the file README instead of README.MD
fields.summary: Edit README does not open the README.MD (BB-10630)

fields.description:
I forwarded the CNAME of "www.issocial.de" to "bitbucket.org" and added the to domain to the Custom domain settings. Now the redirect shows our bitbucket site about our team, but not the hosted http://issocial.bitbucket.org/index.html page.

For me seems the CNAME is working but there is a problem with me or bitbucked.

I want the redirect to direct to our page "http://issocial.bitbucket.org/". Project name "issocial.bitbucket.org" and http://issocial.bitbucket.org/ is reachable.

If I redirect the domain "www.issocial.de" to "issocial.bitbucket.org" the result is "There's nothing hosted here."

Do I make a stupid mistake?

I read this one: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Associate+an+existing+domain+with+an+account

Thanks

Nils
fields.summary: CNAME and team page does not work

h1. Git push failed
h2. What I was trying to do
I changed my files and after commiting to local I was trying to push my changes to bitbucket. However, it failed with the following error.

h2. Error showed
<error>
error: SSL certificate problem, verify that the CA cert is OK. Details:
error:14090086:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_SERVER_CERTIFICATE:certificate verify failed while accessing https://arjunsur@bitbucket.org/arjunsur/testing-cxxtest.git/info/refs

fields.description:
I think I am seeing  the same issue as is closed here. https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7718/some-people-cannot-reach-the-bitbucketorg#comment-10172658

What is happening:\\
from a windows 7 command line, I can ping bitbucket.org, but a git clone to either https or ssh address results in 'Could not resolve host: bitbucket.org'.

this appears to be a windows only issue as other people on the same lan using linux have no issues.

thanks
fields.summary: cannot resolve bitbucket.org

fields.description:
I have two hooks configured on one of my repos (elephant_app):  One for Hipchat and one for Codeship.io (a CI/CD service).  I am finding that about 1/3 of the time _both_ of the webhooks fail to trigger on commits to be repo.  It's always either neither or both, never just one.

It never seems to fail twice in a row, but it rarely works twice in a row.  Unfortunately, I can't provide any additional information; I obviously don't have logs for either bitbucket or hipchat.  Since both are Atlassian products, hopefully it should be easy to verify and track down the problem.

An example commit would be b1d16af459092d0ee2428b8bc9680c7a40ec2dbb, which I pushed about 30m ago, and which never showed up in Hipchat or Codeship.  However 686c2d19a27656b0a4b6873b4a359330fb0929c7 from yesterday did work.

Unfortunately, this issue is causing major issues as the hooks are major part of our deployment pipeline.
fields.summary: Intermittent hook issues

fields.description:
I created a repo on 2014-05-14.

I have attempted to assign a logo to the repo a number of times over the last several days with no joy.  The default logo stubbornly refuses to go away:

!4097723153-Untitled%202.png|thumbnail!

* I click on {{Change Logo}} and select a new logo
* I then click on {{Done}} and I get the "updating" animation:

!3567119026-Untitled%203.png|thumbnail!

After that, nothing changes.  Clicking on {{Save Repository Details}} has no effect (per: [https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5286/impossible-to-change-projectlogo|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5286/impossible-to-change-projectlogo]).  The default logo remains in place, both in the repo settings and any page that shows the repo logo (like our team page).

Doing a full page reload or logging in from a completely different computer has no effect.

I have not hit this issue in any of my previous repos (the latest one being created on 2014-03-25).

I have tested on Firefox/osx, Chromium/osx, Safari/osx and Firefox/linux.  Same effects in every case.

h1. Update
It seems that having a really long repo name may be the cause of this problem.  I'll update further with some steps to reproduce the issue sometime soon.
fields.summary: Long Repo Names : Unable to Change Repo Logo from Default (BB-10600)

fields.description: hacked emails,redirects.since dec.has been nighmare

fields.description:
We just had a weird issue for a few minutes where the web UI showed our git master branch as having no commit history, and branches were thousand of commits ahead - https://bitbucket.org/grabone/gocoupons/branches

When I cloned from the repo I got a sensible looking checkout, and looking at the web UI now it's returned to normal - our branches are a few commits ahead/behind of master as expected.

WTF?

private repos have static pages, but there is no authentication to view these.

It would be nice to have a user login requirement as an option for private repo static pages. The pages feature is really useful during development. The BitBucket user authentication itself would be enough for us.

I noticed that when you view commits it has the wrong person's name by my commits. On the main screen it shows me as making it but then it shows Zach Wiesman on the commits page. I know Zach and do work for him and he shares repositories with me but I'm confused as to why his name is showing as me doing the commits. He has never used my Mac or anything.

I already checked the .gitconfig file and I'm in there and not him. Any other ideas?

Thanks\\
Matt

fields.description:
If you upload a picture to include in a private wiki document, it creates a private URL of the form:\\
https://bitbucket.org/repo/REPOID/images/FILEID-FILENAME

However these URLs do not resolve (and more importantly, do so in an uninformative manner) if the wiki is on a custom domain, rather than on bitbucket.org.  The issue can be avoided if you are logged into both your custom domain and bitbucket.org itself, however this is not intuitive.

fields.description:
Hello,

This issue may be related:  BCLOUD-4586

I'm asking for alternative way to implement challenge question on the log in page. At the moment it uses some JavaScript code, which doesn't work in text browsers such as w3m or Lynx.

There are reasons to use text browser when working with source code repository (better interop with mail clients and code editor), which is why I would like to be able to do this. The site is almost usable in w3m. One can browse the public side almost without a problem (not sure about Lynx), but it's not possible to log in at the moment (or maybe I don't know how, please enlighten me?).

I wouldn't mind if you don't test this feature excessively :) (which was the reason to drop the ticked refered to above), I think that text browser users are expecting that kind of attitude, but being a little bit nicer wouldn't hurt ;)
fields.summary: Make log-in challenge not use JavaScript

fields.summary: Server side forking code does not restrict forking of repositories when over limit (BB-10499)

fields.description: The count of repositories shown when updating permissions for all repositories in an account is off by 1. The count on the dashboard and in the teams box on the user profile is correct.
fields.summary: Repository count on Groups page of an account is off by 1 (BB-10495)

fields.description: Pull request isn't closing automatically when merging branch.
fields.summary: Pull request isn't closing automatically when merging branch

fields.description:
It would be great if we could do certain configuration options at a Team level rather than just on per-repo.  If we have a number of repos, it can be very tedious and far to prone to miss one repo when adding common settings to all our repos.

This includes:

* Hooks (like POSTing notifications to 3rd party tools)
* Links (shared JIRA projects, for example)
* Branch Management rules (don't delete master/develop branches,\\
and more.

Don't let just all of these settings stop you from doing them one at a time...they are each useful on their own.
fields.summary: Shared configuration for all repos in a Team (BB-10637)

fields.description:
I have repeatedly uploaded a clean file and downloaded that same file I created. The file I download does not work because an html wrapper is being added to the file: https://bitbucket.org/srick/psyscopetochronoviz/downloads#download-364847 This is getting added to the beginning file only when I download the file directly: 
And this is getting added to the end:
This html wrapper is unwanted as it is breaking my script. Is this a known issue? If I go to the file and save it from raw there is no issue but this is not ideal.

fields.description:
An issue was already logged for this but was marked as resolved and we do not have the rights to re-open. As this issue is really critical for us I am logging the same issue again:

Previous ticket: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/9456/git-push-failing-with-error-remote-error

The problem is that our push to Bitbucket fails with:\\
Push failed\\
remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device[K error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit error: failed to push some refs to 'https://bitbucket.org/ixorcvba/isps.front.git'
fields.summary: Git Push failing with error "remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device"

fields.description:
I suddenly can't clone/fetch/push to one of my git repositories. This looks similar to bug BCLOUD-9408.

Here is what I get:

{code}
#!bash
dmancusi@phnpcd76:test$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:arekfu/incl.git .
Cloning into '.'...
conq: repository does not exist.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists.
{code}

Fetching from/pushing to this repository won't work, either. Other repositories on my account work fine, so it's not an authentication problem (indeed, {{ssh -Tv git@bitbucket.org}} succeeds). Perhaps there is a problem on the server side?
fields.summary: git clone/fetch/push don't work

fields.description:
unable to create temporary file: No space left on device\\
Looks like this has been posted here before. Can you take a look? Do you need more info from me?

It's not resolved issue BCLOUD-8121 don't set duplicate it

git@bitbucket.org:metricscat/appinions.git
fields.summary: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device

fields.description:
Smart commits is an excellent feature to link BitBucket commits - and the code changes - to JIRA issues. However, if a user forgets to add the issue key to the commit and then pushes upstream, it's very hard (without breaking the git repo for others) to add the issue key to the commit message. It would therefore be very useful to be able to manually link an earlier commit - and its code - to an existing JIRA issue, as if the issue key had been included in the commit message.

The commit message doesn't need to be changed, but the code changes and commit ID should be added to the issue.

This could be done with a separate UI to attach JIRA issues to an existing commit. When displaying JIRA issues, in addition to searching in the commit message, it would also search the new JIRA-issue-and-commit association configured via the new UI.

The same thing could be applied to branches. Pull requests might be fine, as we could easily update the pull request title to include the issue key.
fields.summary: Add ability to link previous commits to existing JIRA issues (BB-10211)

fields.description:
Is it possible to use a simple url for viewing wiki pages.

For example\\
http://wiki.bitbucket.org/[user]/[repoo]

That would be a simplified rendering without all the extra heading etc when accessing via the normal url.

The idea being for people who are reading the wiki etc it's 'friendly'/cleaner view with less clutter and less confusing for less technical users.  Maybe a simple toolbar to link back to normal bitbucket ui.
fields.summary: Simple url for wiki (BB-10485)

fields.description:
I have linked my Google account to a team account on Bitbucket and now it is impossible to unlink it - so that I can use it on my personal bitbucket account.

The team account is now discontinued - so I can't access settings of that account. Is there a way how to unlink the Google account from a team account?\\
Can you unlink it manually for me?

In case this is a private ticket I send you the account info. Thanks for your help.
fields.summary: Unlinking Google Account from an old team account
Can't push with ssh key

fields.description:
If you try to create a branch with a name that has limitations according to the options picked in "Limit pushes to specific users and groups", you get a non-informative error message.

It says "Invalid branch name", instead of something more useful such as "You are not allowed to create a branch with this name because of X rule"
fields.summary: Invalid branch name, when trying to create a branch. (BB-10482)

fields.description:
Multiple team members here have experienced an issue where when they open the accept invitation link and fill in the form's fields the "Accept Invitation" button is not enabled.

This is happening on Windows 7 across Chrome latest, Firefox latest, and IE 11.

Workaround seems to be to not only just tab off the captcha field, but you must tab off of all fields starting with username. By "Tab Off" I mean select the field and then press the tab key repeatedly. My best guess is the validation isn't triggered if you simply click out of the field.
fields.summary: Accept Invitation form not enabling "Accept Invitation" button properly (BB-10491)

fields.description:
now it gets submitted only on ctrl+enter. Nothing happens on cmd+enter\\
ctrl is not the primary meta key on a Mac

Thx

fields.description:
I struggle with push to a *mercurial* repository. I search through the issue database and discovered lots of related and resolved issues and the hint to open a new issue and not to add my problem to the [only open issue, which is related to a *git* repository|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/9456/git-push-failing-with-error-remote-error]. Therefore I opened up this as a new issue.

In my repository https://bitbucket.org/sjorek/pygments-json-formatter I get the following error while issuing the following push-command:

{code}
#!shell

$ hg push
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/sjorek/pygments-json-formatter
searching for changes
5 changesets found
remote: abort: could not lock repository /data/c01/n01/p/vp0048/data/d-953/r-3848953: No space left on device
abort: unexpected response: empty string
{code}

Could you please add some space to or free some space on the device ? :-)

Thx a lot,

Stephan Jorek
fields.summary: hg push failing with: abort: could not lock repository …: No space left on device

fields.description: Team members experience problems when downloading from the "Downloads" section ZIP archives. In the ZIP there are mainly PSD files. Message errors "Duplicate headers received from server" or there is a recursive ZIP in ZIP, ie unzipping will open a second ZIP and this in a loop. Please verify and report about this issue. Thanks

fields.description:
When i set up a hook Pull Request POST, everything is correct for the pullrequest_created call. But when the hook is called with pullrequest_updated, the id of the pull request is not in the payload. I don't have any other field i can rely on (like the api url for this PR, etc.).

Actually this is blocker bug in the workflow - we can't use the api without this Id.

If you need further details, just ask.
fields.summary: Hook pull request does not provide id on update

fields.description:
I have two repositories : home_configs and libraries.

For about two weeks now, when I try to git clone the libraries repository, the files retrived are files from the home_configs repository.\\
.git/config file gives me the correct remote url (libraries), but the content is wrong.

Therefore, I'm not able to get the libraries repository from a new computer.

A weird thing is that from an already cloned libraries repository on another computer, I've tried to push commits and they are pushed on the correct repository, according to the bitbucket web interface.

I've also tried to fork the repository, and the web interface is showing the correct content whereas the cloned forked repository still has the wrong content.
fields.summary: git clone retrives the wrong repository

fields.description:
I've got several accounts on Bitbucket and need to frequently switch between them. When I log out, I'm getting the signup page, and have to select "login" again from the top menu to login with another account.

Suggesting to show the login page after logout - this is kind of standard and sounds like the more probable desired action, compared to signup.
fields.summary: Show login page after logout instead of signup page (BB-10481)

fields.summary: Sessions reporting ... (BB-10477)

fields.description:
zenodo.org is a research sharing platform. They offer Github\\
integration, basically meaning that a certain "release" of a software\\
project hosted at github is archived in zenodo and assigned a DOI\\
(unique digital object identifier).

I think it would be cool if they could do the same with bitbucket.\\
Therefore, I reached out to the guys at zenodo, and this is what they\\
ansered:

bq. Dear Andreas,

Thanks for your interest in Zenodo. We do not currently have plans on integrating BitBucket, however it's definitely something we are open for.

BitBucket APIs is nevertheless missing some key features to make the integration as nice as with GitHub. First, BitBucket allows a user to manually add a hook, but does not have an API for adding hooks (note, hooks are the way Zenodo would get notified about new releases in BitBucket). This means that we can't make a solution where a user signs in with their BitBucket account in Zenodo, and flip a switch to start preserving their repository. The user would manually have to add copy/paste a URL from Zenodo to BitBucket. Secondly, we only preserve "releases" in GitHub, and currently BitBucket does not have this concept (this is less of an issue though).

Best regards,\\
Lars
fields.summary: Provide API for adding hooks
